intro: Boucerosia maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Morocco. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and is adapted to survive in dry, rocky environments. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a hardy species suitable for xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
